data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If people were always facing forward they would be able to walk backwards by taking 10 steps. So, the answer is yes.

If you turn right, you turn around. The same instructions can only be done once. So, the answer is No.

You cannot take 6 steps and take 4 steps at the same time. There is no way to quickly return to your starting point. So, the answer is No.

The first one is how you enter this sentence. So, it is the original sentence. The second sentence instructs you to go forward once and go 7 steps. So, the answer is yes.
